Dropped by here for lunch. It was pretty empty though I could tell they were getting lots of pickup orders. You can order takeout at the counter or sit down to eat. I sat down and ordered the Beijing Street Noodles. The portion was honestly pretty big - lots of noodles, minced pork, and shredded cucumbers. Didn't notice the black bean sauce but overall pretty good. Overall, pretty straightforward place with nice portions and good prices for Williamsburg ($12 for this). Would definitely recommend and try the rest of their menu.

This was a nice spot in Williamsburg that i walked into. The food was okay, they have a happy hour that is pretty good. I tried the crispy chicken wings with soy garlic sauce, a mint mojito, and a scallion pancake. The wings were okay. They were crispy but the sauce didn't do it for me. I've had better soy garlic sauce. Also, you can't take the happy hour food to go. It must be eaten in the establishment which is okay. The ambiance was cool. It was a cool mixture of hip hop, pop and R&B. They have a couple tables where you can dine in. The service was just okay. The lady at the counter was busy doing other things each time we approached the counter. So it wasn't the best service. I asked a question about one of the food items and decided against it by the way she described it. It was almost as if we were disturbing her. I hate that feeling. All in all, this place was just okay. I don't think I'll return tho. I'm sure there's better bao buns down Bedford. See pics below

Very average place for dumplings. The xiao long bao wasn't amazing and I wouldn't get it here again. The curry fried rice was also ok. The service was very meh. They got annoyed because we asked for extra utensils/plates which was kinda of off putting and felt kinda cheap.

Mr. bao has been popping up everywhere! And this location is open late so it's perfect for a bite after a night out. Fast service, good amount if seating. Food comes out hot! The buns are chewy and soft as they should be! Check this place out for a quick bite. They also offer takeout on several platforms. My favorite is the duck bao buns. They are so chewy and soft yet a meaty- nice balance.

I've ordered delivery a few times from here & it's always been so good, fresh, and relatively well priced. My personal favorites have been the shrimp dumplings (the dipping sauce is excellent) as well as the scallion pancakes - which are perfectly crispy and chewy. They also get bonus points because they're open late for those wee hour cravings!

Solid Dim Sum available until 2am. I recommend the pork fried dumplings, the shrimp dumplings. The popcorn ship had a great seasoning on it, and the green beans were perfect. Really impressive that they make everything fresh and homemade.

Service was efficient and friendly, the food was amazing (especially the pork XLB), and they had the white peach soda I can't seem to ever find. I can't wait until we come back to New York so I can bring my boyfriend!
So good and the delivery came early! It's one of the few places that offer delivery in this area late at night!

I have gotten about half the menu at this point & it's basically all good. No matter what I get, I always add the steamed soup dumplings & then usually have leftovers of whatever else I got. The braised beef is great & all those bowls have a jammy soy sauce egg that makes everything better.

Everything i got hit just right!!! The spicy soup dumplings, shrimp, pork and mushroom dumplings with the Szechuan sauce Â and the popcorn fried chicken. All come with very tasty sauces. Open late. What else you want. Eat it there hot and ready and youll be extra happy

I love this place starting off with duck wrap! Omg I can have this every day,very delicious second of all the spicy noodles you have to try it,i usually door dash from here so all I have to do is shake my noodle in the container and bam Â right offf with the spicy ! Hmmm the beef noodle soup love it as well but I wished they had a different type of noodle like glass noodle or a thinner noodle ,the noodles they use are to starchy and get stuck to together when put on the go container,to thick to pick up with chopsticks but over all YUMMy!

Their Braised short rid is fawking Â i got the short rib bowl with rice and garlic cucumber and side of their garlic string beans and damn ! So happy and content, the string beans are perfect never soggy ! Deff a 5 thumbs up and good packaging and sweet staff, sorry i started eating the bowlbefore the pic lol

really wanted a light meal and ordered a vegetable soup. It was super salty and impossible to drink. I have no idea where is the vegetable besides the few pieces floating on top. I paid 5 bucks for this and it is very disappointing.
Been there a once a while back, love all those small plates. Â The place is pretty small with attentive service and good food. I Â will definitely go back for more soup dumplings.

This is one of my favorite Chinese dim sum restaurants in Williamsburg I've ever been to! And I've been all over the world including to China! The Chef Special was phenomenal! Â The soup dumplings were top notch! I'm obsessed with the Chrysanthemum tea too. Kiki, our server was the best. She is so kind and polite. I highly recommend it

Super good place I came here with my friend after we looked around. I love soup dumplings so I got the pork crab soup dumpling it was super good. It's not as the best as compared to the ones I go at China town but still great

This place is totally on point re food and the people who work there are wonderful!! Â I always enjoy the experience whether sitting in or taking out. Â My personal opinion is the vegan spring rolls are tops in the neighborhood!
Amazing. Best soup dumplings in Brooklyn. Had an amazing time, staff is great- I definitely recommend to anyone who is in Brooklyn to try them out
Chef's dumplings, short rib guabao, roasted duck wrap should be on every single order. Don't pay attention to how it looks from the outside, the food is really really tasty.

Ordered take out. I got the create your own - jasmine rice, wild mushroom & salt & pepper shrimp. The shrimp had very good flavor. I was a little surprised by the mushroom. I was expecting something different but overall it still taste good. It reminds me of seaweed.

One and done. With the amount of places that serve dim sum this is not worth another try. Ordered about five different dumplings and a duck appetizer. The duck was oily and the paper wrapping was hard to distinguish. The dumpling fillings were flavorful and definitely worthy of a bit of a yummy praise however the dumpling masa (dough) was so thick and on some so mushy it was unpleasant and inedible. Overall I'd say try any of the many other spots around. (Note: my eats were pre-covid times).
Ordered the dan dan noodles, duck wrap, and soup dumplings-- all absolutely delicious. Can't believe this place doesn't have a 5 star rating! Can't wait to try everything else.

I'm so glad I tried this place again. It's not somewhere I would dine in at, but the food is amazing. I can't get over how good the braised beef was. It was succulent and the flavor was perfect. The smashed cucumbers were also sooo good. I wanted more! I liked the option for Korean style multigrain rice. The duck roll is also awesome. It's super flavorful. I came back just for that. The chicken wings are very crisp fried Korean fried chicken style. My friend raved about the dumplings - he had pork and chive and chicken and cabbage. To me they seem standard. He couldn't tell which was which but was very happy and ate every drop. I do wish the dine in experience was better. It's definitely more of a takeout place. Oh and the customer service was great! I accidentally placed my online order to the Park Slope location, and when I called to cancel they transferred the order for me. They made it nice and easy for me, which I really appreciated. Will be back!
Great fresh food. They forgot to enter one of the dishes but it turned out fine because we were pretty full by dish #3. Would definitely go back again.
Fantastic spicy wontons, hot and sour soup, and duck wrap. Highly recommend late night takeout
Everything was bomb. The Taiwanese fried chicken wrap was my favorite. Love that they're open later than most places these days.
Amazing food and the lady at the register is a Doll .. I love this place .. Williamsburg does have it all

More like Mr WOW! The food is incredible. Just take a look at the picture attached to this review. If that isn't beautiful, idk what is then. I have to say that the meat was so tender, I could just bite it off with my mouth without using utensils. I do not recommend. Less so if you are on a date. But that tells you how good that was. Maybe the rice could have been more on point but everything else was delicious.

The staff is so friendly. All the food is delicious and fresh, been there several times and it has always come out really fast. A great place to go, especially if you're gluten free, they cook many dishes with tamari and the staff is knowledgeable about many allergies.
No comment

I guess this place is part of a chain. Basically Asian fast food. The menu looks good but we found most of it really awful. The fried calamari was so greasy. The Beijing Street noodles were awful, tasteless and gummy store bought noodles. The soup dumplings were edible, but still not recommended. The service is all plastic even if you sit at a table and order from a waiter. You can do so much better in this neighborhood! Vanessa's Dumplings is similar but WAY better. M/Shanghai has much better soup dumplings.

Delivery soup dumplings are kind of a white whale and these are quite, quite good. Â Cue XLB snobs saying they're not good... Yes, I know the holy grail of XLB is typically to get the thinnest skin possible, but I don't really care, and these are not too thick. Also, I'm not going to flushing or the Bao on St Marks every time I want a soup dumpling. Â The crab and pork are delicious, get them. I wasn't a huge fan of the "sandwich" baos (including the duck others seem to like, it was glazed with too much soy/hoisin for me) or the non-soup dumplings. The best chicken dish is the sichuan (but it's not actually, it's American style kung pao/ sesame chicken with a different sauce, which is not very spicy and more sweet). Â I'll try some of the other dishes, but it's called Mr Bao, so, like, I guess start with the baos right?
I ordered fried rice, soup dumplings, a duck roll and shumai. Nothing tasted good. Lacking flavor. The rice was specially plane

Food was amazing and filling. Sorry No pic I Was hungry. I ordered Pork Bao bun was fluffy and pork inside was juicy. I also got Taiwanese fried chicken bowl with vegetable fried rice & green beans delicious. Definitely check this spot out.

Popped in on a whim cause the exterior looked promising. Dumplings were good and I would order the again. However, both the noodle dishes we got(the Dan Dan and Beijing) were flavorless, watery, and the meat was like chopped cat food. Would not return.

This place had the BEST soup dumplings we have ever had. Â The staff was very nice and they got our order together pretty quickly to-go. Â We got those delicious soup dumplings and some shrimp fried rice. Â Both were good (especially the soup dumplings - did I mention that?), and their soy sauce was also uniquely tasty. Â It had a stronger vinegar taste, which we loved. Â We don't typically pour soy sauce into our rice, but we dumped it all over. Â Great spot, great food.. we look forward to coming back.

Kinda disappointing. Nothing we ate was really that good except the duck wrap, which was good but greasy. Even the crab soup dumplings which seemed to be the thing to get were pretty meh. The noodles we got tasted like plain pasta and the memory of them is so bad I just took another star off my rating. 2/5 stars generally, 1/5 for the genre of food.

Cute shop with affordable dumplings! The pork soup dumplings were my absolute favorite! The steamed chicken dumplings were also amazing. Really big portion sizes as well. The bao buns were incredibly fluffy. Would recommend coming with a group so you can share! Come here for a more casual lunch and most important come very hungry.

Fairly new spot. Very cute and cozy. Love the ceiling decor. It was the first thing that caught my attention. Make sure you look up when you enter :). They have both indoor and out door available. The staff was amazing !!! It was my first time there and someone took time to help and explain everything on the menu. The food was delicious. I recommend getting the soup filled dumplings. It was more of an experience eating than anything. I would definitely recommend this location and will be back the next time I'm in the area !!

Love their dumplings! My favorite are the chicken ans cabbage and their pan friend soup dumplings. Great price and texture, the dough is not too thick, good amount of filling. Their bao is perfectly chewy but soft. I've yet to try their noodle or rice bowls but will definitely come back.

We stumbled upon this place while walking in the neighborhood and ordered out. The food is excellent especially the Short Rib and Fried Chicken Bao. The Shumai and Popcorn shrimp deserve an honorable mention. The Dan-Dan noodles were so-so! I would definitely come back here ... either do pick-up or eat-in if I was looking for a casual place to catch-up with a friend.

We ordered Mr Bao for lunch via seamless, and the food was FANTASTIC!!! We ordered the pork soup dumplings, the pan fried shrimp and pork bao, shu mai, the set of 3 baos (pork, beef, vegetable), and the sesame balls. Can I just say, the baos are SO CHEWY and the fillings are so delicious?!? As Chinese/Taiwanese, I'm all about authentic Chinese food. Mr. Bao definitely nailed the authenticity aspect and then more. The taste and texture of every food is so amazing and the looks are beautiful!!! Will definitely come back a lot more!

I'm doing hair around here so I ordered take out. The buns are so good! My favorite one is the duck steamed bun, it tastes good even gets cold, very refreshing. The fried chicken I ordered is not that crispy since it's take out, but still juicy.
Pretty good soup dumplings and reasonable pricing. great addition to the neighborhood.
Great soup dumplings! Can't wait to try other items! Baos are super good and super cute

The bao is really small, and it's underwhelming. The meat is really chewy and the sandwich is barely filled. Seriously a rip off! Not to mention take out took 40 minutes for one bao sandwich. I recommend going to any other place for bao.
The dumplings were quite a surprise, alot better than other dumpling spot in the area.
I ordered Beijing street noodles, it tasted great. They have both indoor and patio available.
I ordered shrimp dumplings, shrimp and pork shumai and vegetarian wrap. Everything was amazing. Delicious and fresh. The staff is very friendly too. Great experience.

Excellent mid-town choice for delicious Chinese in a very chic atmosphere (be sure to make a reservation!). We started with fancy cocktails; the Good Fortune was tasty and not too sweet. The pork soup dumplings were very delicious with thick dough (just as I like it) and a hearty, soupy filling. The dan dan noodles were also exceptional. The snow pea shoots were a must order, and the Shanghai shumai were quite tasty (my friend said it reminded her of her grandmother's dishes from childhood). We also ordered the Szechuan beef, which was so yummy, but also felt very Americanized, which we didn't expect given everything else we ate. Anywho, come enjoy a wonderful meal at Blue Willow!

Heard great things about this place so I wanted to check it out. Not sure what the hype is besides the cool decor, as the food was kind of mediocre. The flavor of the spicy wontons was good, perfect anount of ma and la, but the sesame noodles really lacked flavor and was overly watery. The noodles were also oddly choppy. The shao mai was not bad, the rice was a bit too mushy but the flavor was good. The kung pao chicken was super disappointing though. Super liquidy, wasn't spicy, lacked flavor all around. Service was great though!

Updating my review to reflect the current state of the food. Since the chef changed last year, the same dishes have tasted significantly different. I no longer come back to this restaurant or order delivery from here anymore. It's just not the same. Many dishes are a shadow of their former selves. Previously some dishes were outstanding, but now they are just decent.

The staff are super helpful with the menu and proactive in topping up your water glasses. Definitely recommend the mala dry pots if it's your first time here. Choose 4-8 different items to be cooked into the pot with Chinese spices and sauces. Keep in mind the portions are large and very filling.

I got takeout from here tonight for dinner, and it definitely filled my Chinese food craving. We ordered the general Tso's chicken, the Szechuan beef, the garlic string beans, the Dan Dan noodles, and some hot and sour soup. The favorite was definitely the green beans but the meat dishes were good too! We were not fans of the noodles as they did not have enough sauce and left too strong of a sesame aftertaste, but everything else was good!

When most everyone there is Asian you know it's going to be good. Great flavor, generous portion sizes and not too sauced. Very glad we stopped into this authentic place. Attentive service and dark enough decor to feel you were eating alone yet in a busy restaurant.

This restaurant has a very nice ambiance with rich, dark colors and old pictures of what looks like Chinese nobility on the walls -- maybe something like what I'd imagine a high-end opium den to be like. Upon entering we were asked if we could keep it to two hours which we found humorous and easily agreed to. The food came out shortly after ordering. For appetizers, we had Dan Dan noodles which were very tasty and sweet and sour ribs which came up short and I would not recommend. The Peking duck and Szechuan beef were both good dishes but what was really exceptional were the garlic green beans! If you're wanting Chinese and happen to be in this area of midtown just south of Central Park definitely consider Blue Willow. I would definitely return but it's not necessarily a place I would frequent.

Great menu and great prices. I went with a bunch of friends, service was great and would definitely book again.

Vibes, food, service all 10/10. First time coming here and I absolutely loved it. Everything was authentically spicey (which I love) but there are also many options to try if you can't handle spice. I espicially loved the fish, which was so tender and came with so many veggies. Overall, great experience, would come again.

Really enjoyed the dinner here. We came with a group and did family style so we could try more items on the menu. The restaurant had really cool vintage looking chinese decor, they had long tables that were great for groups and there is outdoor seating available. The service was great and the food came out pretty quickly. I will definitely be back for the flavorful string beans, garlic egg plant, chairman maos braised pork belly (don't forget the rice) and the Peking duck!

Dark atmosphere very but very comfortable. Overall a very good experience.

If you want satisfying Szechuan food, this is a great place to go to. I got several recommendations for this place before I went and can understand the rave. I ordered their mapo tofu, dan dan noodles, garlic eggplant, soup dumplings, and shu mai. I would rank my favorite dishes in that order. I loved the flavor of the dan dan noodles with the perfect blend of peppercorn and nuttiness. The only part that could have been better is the moistness of the noodle+sauce blend. It was a bit dry. The interior design is pretty cool too. It has a retro style with a blue themed background throughout the place. It's a great place for groups to share food in family style. If you're going for lunch, one tip is to reserve for an earlier time when they just open up so that you can avoid the crowd.

The food was prepared very quickly, especially for a Friday night, however it did not live up to its expectations. The food was good but not great. Portions were small as well. We Â ordered Hunan Stir Fried Noodles with chicken which had dry doubanjiang paste. Wish there was more sauce incorporated on the noodles. Kung Pao Chicken served with peanuts, peppercorn and chili peppers, however this did not pack any heat. The best dish was the Garlic Sauced Chicken however there were way too many water chestnuts. Overall the restaurant was mediocre and bland.

Fantastic spot to come large or small groups. The food is phenomenal and they have a cozy environment. Service was good and the food came out fast. The fish is a big winner as well as the pork. Definitely coming back!

He is so passionate and mixed us a chrysanthemum cocktail with chrysanthemum ice cubes! For real. We got wood ear Â mushrooms and it was great and tangy - ya hear! Also ordered delicious lotus root with rice - my favorite. Grandmas rice noodles were ok - little spicy for my taste. Get going and sit at the bar. Pray that Eddie is there that night because he is EVERYTHING!

I absolutely loved the Xiang River Fish, and the portion is great for sharing. The drinks here are amazing as well, not overly sweet but also really unique. I also really enjoyed the Braised Pork, it was perfectly sweet and salty. Definitely want to make a reservation ahead of time as this place gets packed!

The mapo tofu and the mala dry pot were just spicy instead of the "ma" flavor. The best thing I had from the meal was the qipao drink - maybe it would have a been a difference experience to come here for drinks only. In terms of just Chinese food, there are much better options in the city.

The severs were attentive & courteous. Humming conversations. Soft music in the background. An excellent spot for family & friends. Loved it. Try it & tell me how you like it.

Even the cold sesame noodles, generally not a spicy dish, are spicy at Blue Willow. All the food is very good and well worth the trip to Midtown.

Amazing location with great 20th century old china town vibes. Dining room had great energy and aesthetic. However food and service was lacking. Out of the 4 items we ordered only liked two. Hard pass on the Chengdu noodles and must try the Chengdu spicy dumplings!

Came here on a Friday night around 9 pm based on our friends recommendation. Food was excellent. We ordered scallion pancakes, veggie dumplings, garlic green beans, cucumber salad, and my friends also got the salt and pepper prawns and beef noodle. We also got the pea sprouts. Everything was delicious! Service was not the greatest but the restaurant closed at 10 so we did feel a bit rushed. But overall I'd come back and really enjoyed the meal!

Food tastes ok but kind of pricy. For the roast duck, they only give 5 pieces of the wraps. If you want more, you need to pay. The waitress claimed no matter how many people in a group, they only give 5 pieces. That is so not reasonable in my opinion.

The smell alone is amazing. Such a cute outside area that you can even utilize in the winter (just bundle up). The food is amazing. Great quality and great portions. Warning: if it says spicy, they mean spicy! Order accordingly. Wide variety of drink specials, as well. Totally recommend.

Great date spot, the theme was 1920s, very nice decor and and felt like I was transported. The staff were very attentive and wait time for our food to come out was about 10 minutes. The food was good along with the presentation. However their Peking duck was average. I would come back to try more dishes from their menu.
Delicious food! I have three meals here in three days. So I have the chance to try different food on the menu. All the choices are good. And it is very easy to make the reservation. Like this place.

The vibes here are impeccable. There's a constant chatter as it gets pretty busy even on a Thursday night-- reservations are highly recommended. The menu is labeled well with vegan options, and there is quite a selection of drinks. I highly recommend the cold sesame noodles, which were the perfect amount of sauce, and great nutty sweet salty flavor. Beautiful restaurant. Â Service was outstanding. Â Food was very good. Â We did not try much since there was only two of us and neither are big eaters. Â The cocktails were amazing! Â Sooooo good!

This was the most amazing and authentic Chinese food I have ever had. There custom drinks were well made. The Mai Tai was fabulous. We ordered the pork soup dumplings! Highly recommend. Will be back!
The outdoor dining service is amazing. You'll never regret if you come here. Really authentic Chinese food!

Undistinguished food. Â Worth avoiding unless uninteresting Chinese food is your thing.

Really tasty food and our waiter Debbie was very helpful and accommodating . We shared all the dishes and our fav was the Cauliflower one and the golden prawns. The busboy with the blond hair was also very nice .
Great food and amazing ambience! The Blue Willow fish is so tender and super flavorful.

A solid 5 stars! This place has the best peking duck I've ever had. It was crispy, a little fatty and very tasty. The fried rice was also pretty good! I will def be going back here to try a few more of their other dishes !
Highly recommend the cucumber (appetizer) and the Qin Hua Jiao Fish. The vibe here is awesome. They also have great cocktails using Chinese liquor as base.
Really liked the food. Dry pot could have been less salty, ask for less salt if you are ordering this
Very solid food. We got a Chairman Mao's pork belly, some veggies, and mapo tofu. Everything was very savory. I highly recommend the dessert and cocktails

Food was solid! I'd come back for sure and order what I didn't last time, because it was that good

Excellent Hunan cuisine! Fresh ingredients, authentic food with bold flavors, sizable portions and fantastic ambiance. Great place to go with a group for family style dining. Mapo tofu was my personal favorite, but you can't go wrong with anything you order. However, I would say you can get better soup dumplings elsewhere. The menu is extensive and I will definitely be back with a larger group and empty stomach to explore more delicious dishes at Blue Willow!
I really loved their fried rice and soup dumplings! I ordered and picked up the food, so I didn't get a chance to try the food at the restaurant. But the food was still great packed!

We stumbled upon Blue Willow while walking through midtown after Christmas. What an amazing surprise! The interior is beautiful - like being transported back into China from a bygone era. And the food was exceptional. We've lived in New York for 5 years and this was some of the best Chinese we've had in a while - and all reasonably priced. We had the soup dumplings, ma po tofu, spicy chili wontons, and a fried chicken dish. The soup dumplings in particular were exceptional. Our waiter Terry was excellent. We will be back!
Good Chinese food in a nice but somewhat dark setting Â - convenient to lots of midtown events. Yummy dumplings.

Great food service and atmosphere, braised pork was to die for would recommend trying

Terry was super nice, food was amazing and ambiance was extremely homey! Food was actually sublime.
Menu has such a wide variety and every dish was delicious. Perfect for spice lovers! The three chili signs are no joke.

Amazing place. Food is perfect, and the service is absolutely wonderful. Terry was our waiter, and got our food out at record speed. The decor is cool, the soundtrack is great, and they have a full bar. Highly recommend.

I really wanted to like it but everything was mediocre. The restaurant itself is beautiful. It has an old Shanghainese feel to it and the decorations are on point. I had a reservation for a birthday dinner and I brought in a cake beforehand the day of. We got seated in a room and ordered drinks and food. We also checked in to get the chrysanthemum iced tea. For drinks we tried the empress Wu, good fortune, lychee martini, and lost in translation. The drinks were okayyy, some of them were too artificial and some had a interesting blend of flavors. Presentation was better. For food wise we got the numbing beef tendon cold plate, chengdu Dan Dan noodles, chili oil braised beef, eggplant and beans, golden prawn, ma ma peppercorn fish, and mapo tofu. My favorite out of all the dishes was the golden prawn because they have it fried in a egg yolk covering. The dishes were also on the smaller side so this was just right for 6 people. Â The issue came later on when they gave us the check but they charged us for the chrysanthemum tea so we told them and they said they'll take it off and then it took half an hour for the check to come back. In between that time another server came by with the check again and we told them again but this server said we had to write a review on the spot but the other server said it was fine. Then we asked about the cake and they couldn't find it and it took another 20 min for them to bring the cake into the room and left. So waiting for the check and getting it corrected took over half an hr.
Authentic Hunan Cuisine in Manhattan! Fast and outdoor services available. And it's drink menu is impressive! You won't go wrong with anything here!

The service was ok but the food was really bad. Literally nothing like the Chinese cuisine that our whole table was familiar with. Savoury noodle ended up oddly sweet, dumplings ended up very blend and tasteless... Definitely not coming back again.
This place is so delicious!! I had such an amazing experience. Great ambiance and even better food. Will be coming back!
Most delicious meal I have had in a while!! So spicy and flavor packed. Loved the experience in the private dining room with my friends.
We ate at Blue Willow tonight. Food was delicious and the service was great. Awesome authentic sichuan food in midtown. 10/10 recommend!

Ate here pre theater for dinner. Had high hopes after reading reviews but was disappointed and I must say after the last few restaurants we tried after using Yelp as a guide, I don't trust Yep anymore. I think the reviews here are about as valid as reviews on Amazon. Get a bunch of friends to post good things. The service was absolutely horrible. We were informed when we were seated Â that we had a 90 minute limit, which we were fine with, but then it took 20 minutes to take our drink order. We wound up ordering our dinner at the same time since we had had plenty of time to look at the menu and the food for 3 of the 4 of us came quickly, but they totally forgot my son's food and trying to flag someone to remind them to forever. Then it took 20 minutes to bring him his food while ours got cold waiting for his. It was shrimp fried rice which does not take long to cook. I will say his was the tastiest meal. My sesame chicken was average, my daughter's kung pao chicken was tasteless and while my husband's General Tso chicken was spicy as promised, it was super dry. The glass of Sancerre was a half glass. Needless to say we will not be back.
Honestly... great! It was great, including and especially the Ube ice cream! Yum yum yum!! :)
Went here for date night-- ambiance was very pleasant. Highlights were the taro cakes and beef fried rice. They have private rooms too, so would likely be good for birthdays or other events.
Very fast and helpful servers. Food was very good. They were very busy so I recommended making a reservation.

Terrible service. Â Rude, disrespectful and unprofessional. Â I've been visited this place since the grand opening. Â It was a nice place to have a decent Chinese food. Â Now the city has recovered. Â Clearly old customers or customers in general, are less important to them now..

Great atmosphere, the food was tasty and the drinks good. I love that the space is well arranged so you could bring a date here or a large group.

This place is amazing! Loved the Dan Dan noodles and dumplings. Perfect amount of peppercorn in each dish

Food is maybe a 3/10. Some dishes were hit or miss, not very authentic. Overly expensive and nothing came in a timely fashion. Tried to kick us out an hour before another reservation, when they still didn't bring us all the food or drinks. Tried to force us to pay more tip, although we paid what we thought was decent for this (18%). Definitely try other places then this. Some positives were the waiters and the decor.

Very good taste and spacious outdoor sitting. Make sure you can handle spicy or ask them for mild spicy, because it's truly authentic Hunan style!!

I wish I took pictures of the food but everything was so delicious we devoured it all so quickly! We got the sour and spicy fish, chinese watercress, fried buns, twice cooked pork, fried rice, mapo tofu, and some others that I don't remember. Everything was decently spicy and perfectly seasoned! Our waiter (I think his name was Eric) was also amazing, he gave the best service, he was so nice and checked up on us often. Definitely a must try!
Good restaurant, went there for dinner, and the atmosphere is great. Price is not very expensive either.

All the dishes were so delicious. It's hard to pick just one that was really the winner. The salt and pepper shrimp was amazing as was Grandma's soup. Everyone must try the cucumbers and garlic green beans! They are a must.
Wonderful ambiance and great service. The food was a little spicy but Very delicious. I highly recommend for anyone visiting New York.

The staff was so accommodating especially with a large group of 15 people, they went out of their way to serve us and was very enthusiastic and efficient! Had so much fun celebrating my graduation with the family and thank you for the restaurant and especially Terry haha for making this such a great night!
Excellent drinks and good vegetarian options like lao ma puffed tofu. Great ambience.

$80 worth of Hunan food delivered 8 minutes after order was placed. Everything was excellent, including chairman mao's braised pork, beef stew, snow pea shoot, and golden corn. Can't explain this greatness.

Excellent food! Best Hunan restaurant in midtown...maybe even all of Manhattan. We got the chive flowers, mapo tofu, Changsha chicken and ma ma fish. Everything was delicious and arrived super fast. Our server Terry was friendly and gave great recommendations!
We had such a wonderful late lunch today at Blue Willow. Their Szechuan flavors are the best in the city! Terry was our waiter and he provided excellent service! Â Can't wait to come back next time.
Delicious food, loved the beef fried rice and the duck. Our server Tery was so friendly and accommodating. The hostess was also so sweet and got us a spot even though it was such a busy night
Everything was amazing. Everything was impeccable. Will definitely visit again. I am addicted to Sichuan crisp chili oil

Really great ambiance and decor. The food was really good, but nothing I had was mind blowing, which is fine. The specialty thousand year egg and eggplant dish was unique and something I had never tried before. A tad too spicy for me but great flavor. The garlic green beans had the ideal crispy texture and was definitely one of the better versions of that dish that I've had.

This place has been on my list for a while now, and so glad I came here. The food was pretty solid, especially the Peking duck, it hits the spot. The Qing Hua Jiao fish was quite oily but very flavorful, tasted really good with white rice. But overall food was great!!!
Really nice place! Thanks Terry for good help! I will recommend it to my friends. You can also take your children here.

Great place to get authentic Chinese food. I came with a group of 7 and we had a private room. Everyone enjoyed the food, even those who don't typically like spicy food. The ma po tofu and the mountain baked fish were especially good. Would definitely recommend!
Great place !! Food tasty and very fresh! Try Dan Dan noodles wonderful flavor. I lived in Shanghai China four three years and this restaurant rates 5 star China restaurant.

My food was delicious I really enjoyed the service as well and I recommend Terry for a great dining experience.

This restaurant is incredible. Beautiful 1920s decor, amazing Szechuan food that delivers bite after bite that makes you want to eat everything on the table while trying to keep the spice down by chugging water. Highly recommend the garlic string beans!! The best! Also the Lucky Golden Buns & Changsha Spiced chicken are not to be missed. Really friendly staff providing excellent service so shoutout to the whole team
Terry was an excellent waiter and the food here is so delicious!!!! I love the chrystanthemum tea and mapo tofu. I wish I could eat here all the time.
Very nice and authentic. The staff are polite and friendly. Portions are not big and not too small
Love the restaurant. Really great vibes, great dry pot, and great vibes. Ask for terry, Terry was awesome with great service.

I've been here a few times now. I've ordered delivery as well as dining in. The food is very good, and the restaurant could easily deserve a Michelin star. I would rank them a clear tier above Cafe China and other more high-end Chinese restaurants in the city. I do wish that their prices were less extreme, but you do get what you pay for.
Amazing service, outstanding food!! Highly recommend! Cleaned every plate Â Terry was great!

We had a very nice dinner. I had peking duck. Very tasty but a little too fatty. My wife had the crispy beef which was amazing. The fried rice was just OK.
Excellent Szechuan and Chinese food in a great location. Â Amazing cocktails. Terry our server was great too. Â Highly recommend this restaurant.
Live around the block, come here often. The food is great and authentic as someone who has been to Sichuan. Terry our waiter was also very friendly and helpful. Will always come back!

Went here for early lunch, and got outdoor seats. So we cant rate on the place itself, which actually looks nice and unique from the outside. We ordered the tofu (a little salty, but tasted good), the fish with pickled vegetables (was good too), the shumai, and green beans and eggplants. Food was good, the portion is a little small compared to other chinese restaurant. Service was good. Recommended of you like authentic chinese food!

Decor was nice. Flavor for food was not bad at all. Only issue was that all the food that came out was not even hot. We ordered the stew and it was room temp... heard so many good things about this place. Disappointed everything served was cold...
Amazing authentic food. Servers are great. Terry is very nice! Great vibes, highly recommend. The music is also amazing.
Blue Willow always feels authentic to us and everyone enjoyed their meal. Â The spicy dishes were indeed that and the dumplings were delicious if a tad over done.
Food came out quickly and outside seating was great. Eggplant garlic stir fry was excellent. Terry was a great server!
So delicious!! We loved our waiter Terry. Would highly recommend the soup dumplings and Peking duck.

Restaurant was beautifully decorated, giving an old Shanghai feel to the space. Food was super authentic. My Â girlfriend was over the moon happy with the Hunan dishes. (She went to school in Hunan province in China). Service was superb! If you like "properly spicy" dishes (just ask them) this is also on point.
Beautiful outdoor dining area, you can tell they put thought and care into setting up a good dining experience.

Made a reservation a week before, then got hustled out 70 minutes after the reservation with the check on the table and the guy saying he's "so sorry" but there are people waiting. There was no one waiting? And there were empty tables? And any restaurant that doesn't plan for 90 minutes per table at least is doing something wrong. This was our big planned dinner for the weekend and it is ridiculous to pay this much for a meal when you aren't able to enjoy the full experience. Such a bummer.

Extremely poor Chinese food by city standards. Tried a handful of items and none were good. Would not try again given all the great Chinese food available. Â Flavors were mild or non-existent, ingredients sub par. Portion sizes small and fairly expensive. All around poor.
This place was wonderful!! Â Ambiance, food, staff all amazing!! Â Packed house on a Saturday evening but the hostess was accommodating and polite!!

I have been here twice now and tried several dishes on the lunch menu. Each one is a hit! The restaurant is authentic, authentic Hunan food, so expect some serious spicy. Outdoor winter seating during COVID is so cute with individual heat lamps!

This place is very attractive and not overly pricey for the area. But we ordered 3 dishes and ALL of them were so salty we could barely eat them. We've eaten Sichuan food all over the city, but never had an experience like this. I was afraid the chicken with pickled peppers might be too spicy, but it wasn't. It was painfully salty. Also, all 3 dishes (1 beef, 1 chicken, 1 tofu) had the same boring red bell peppers in them, no other vegetables. Left half the food, didn't bother to take it home. Nope, won't be going back here :-(
Wow, just wow. Â Stumbled in during a rainy evening mid week. Â We were able to sit at the bar in the corner. Â Fab ambiance. I could write poems about the duck.
Delicious!!! Recommending this place to all my friends. Favorites were their mapo tofu and Szechuan beef. Pumpkin Mochi dessert was also lovely

I've ordered from Blue Willow a few times and just haven't found anything that good. Maybe going in person is much better, or maybe I'm just ordering the wrong things, because other reviews are very positive.

Delicious hunan/Szechuan food - Â had the wood ear cold dish, chengdu spicy wontons and the Malay dry pot - definitely hit the spot and food was well flavored, authentic and not too heavy. Â Service was attentive and helpful as well! Â Pricier than flushing but that's understandable based on the location. Â I'll be back next time I need my Szechuan fix!
Lovely atmosphere. Great veggie options. Fab cocktails. Love the fringe lamps and decor.
Great food, drinks and atmosphere! Definitely would come back again! Missed the chairman mao's braised pork this time but will be back for that. Flavors were authentic and food was high quality!
Great place for team dinners! Good for big groups. Their cocktails are also really great.

Make a reservation beforehand - it gets packed. Very cool, retro atmosphere. Really enjoyed their dry pot and creative cocktail drinks. Their soup dumplings, however, were so sweet that they didn't taste like traditional dumplings. Overall, cool place to try but not worth going back.

I had dinner with my friends there for my birthday last night. It was incredible food. Terry was our server and he was very helpful. We all loved our friend there. I would highly recommend this place!
Great cherry Manhattan, and great green beans!!! Would go back and get more entrees next time

Delicious food! We ate here multiple times during our visit to NYC. A few of our favorite dishes - the smoked hunan bacon with dried turnips, mala dry pot, Changsha spiced chicken, and century egg clay pot. We'll definitely be back when we're in nyc again!
Food arrived really fast! I was wondering if the chili will be overwhelming, but it was actually not as spicy as I expected. Recommend getting their clay pot dishes

A beautiful restaurant with truly delicious food. We love the Chairman Mao's braised pork (which has a hint of spice but is pretty mild), and the Golden Yolk tofu, which appears to be one of their specialties. I think my husband gets the pickled pepper chicken, which is HOT and burns my tongue unlike anything else. It's super spicy. We've also tried the Golden Corn, which is delicious, but I'd recommend for a larger group rather than a party of 2.
We came here for my girl friend's birthday. Terry our server was so amazing! Food was so good and the service was spectacular! We will definitely come back!

Overall ambiance of the restaurant is amazing. From decor to dim lighting. We tried the dry pot and it was great. Flavorful and displayed well. Reasonable prices. Our party of 5 ate and drank for under $200 . Only reason I don't give 5 stars, it took longer than expected to receive our drinks (came after our appetizers) but it was a Friday night and busy. Would definitely go back to explore other items on the menu!
Food is incredible! Could've easily walked past not knowing it was here. Don't miss this place! Terry was our server and gave great recommendations. Aesthetic was beautiful and unique.
Love the ambiance, attentive service, food was great and very authentic. Definitely would come back

My GO TO Chinese restaurant in NYC. Excellent atmosphere, authentic Hunan food(all my friends love it), great service, more Â importantly their cocktails are sooo delicious! Try their green pepper fish and Peking duck, my favorite! 10/10!

Went back again for the Dan Dan Noodles, the Spicy Chili Chicken on skewers and I was blown away. Â Your taste buds are going to get electrified. The noodles were placed on a thick pool of peanut sauce and topped with minced pork and scallion. The chicken was topped with crushed peanuts, chili oil, and other spices. Flavor was through the roof !

I order delivery from here all the time - My go to order includes chairman mao's braised pork, general Tso's (I know, so basic but its good here!) and I was OBSESSED with the sautÃ©ed cabbage. I wld literally order just the sautÃ©ed cabbage for dinner but I'm crushed because they changed the recipe recently and added peppercorn or something because now it just numbs my mouth and makes everything else taste weird :(

This is hands down the best Chinese food that I've had outside of China! My son is vegetarian, so we mostly stuck to dishes without meat and it did not disappoint. We started with veggie potstickers that were simply amazing and then moved to the Century Egg and Eggplant and Puffed Tofu. Â Again...both were delicious and the spice on the tofu was so good without letting the heat are over. Â Two days later, we are still talking about it - it's that good!

Great Hunan style food! Definitely never had green pancakes that are so fluffy! Their Mapu Tofu and dumplings were great too - just beware of the pepper corn. 4 stars because the peppercorn was a bit too overwhelming after some time! Could not feel the taste after a while;) Would recommended reducing the level of spice!

Great Chinese in midtown. A little on the pricey side but the portions are big and the drinks are good

column6: Love this restaurant! Food is authentic and the ambiance is perfect!! Terry, Joseph and Mark were such good servers. Def recommend!
Blue willow was well worth the trip... all the dishes met or exceeded our expectations.

Food was delicious. Service was pretty terrible...so giving 3 stars. It was packed on a Sunday night. We had a reservation and were seated promptly but no one came to our table for about 20 minutes other than to give us waters. Finally my husband went up to the bar to order our drinks. Every time we wanted to order something we had to flag down someone to come to our table. We had about 5 different waiters over the course of dinner take our order and drop off food. No one ever greeted us, walked us through the menu, asked if we were ok, how was the food, could they bring us anything else, did we want another drink. It's almost like they forgot about us. BUT the Dan Dan noodles, soup dumplings and salt and pepper prawns were amazing.

We visited on Sunday(come before 6 because they usually busy after 7.) This is my first time in Blue Willow and YOU have to go! It's the big spot with amazing food. The service we received was so amazing and we will definitely be back again. The server is amazing! She made us feel welcomed and gave us an amazing experience. And she recommended great food to us and we definitely LOVE those!!! And I love the Eggplant, beans and braised pork there:) Â If you can eat spicy this is MUST TRY and they have a lot of foods here. We will come back again!

The menu looks incredibly promising, but the food falls so short at Blue Willow. First of all, the food does not come out hot. Every dish we received was lukewarm, and we had to ask for the food to be reheated. Second of all, we ordered the snow pea leaves but they failed to cut off the ends of the vegetables, so the dish was incredibly fibrous and stringy, rendering some pieces inedible. Lastly, the dishes were not well seasoned. The snow pea dish we ordered was too sweet - it almost tasted as if the leaves were soaked in sugar. Would not recommend, especially because the restaurant is quite overpriced.
The absolute best meal of our trip. Cannot recommend this restaurant enough. The Chili Oil Braised Beef and Spicy Crispy Wontons are must tries.
